definition: due to/as a result of/thanks to/owing to/since/because
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: All eastbound trains have been cancelled due to faulty signals.
sentences.chinese: 所有向东开去的火车由于信号错误而均被取消。

sentences.english: Some 28 percent of adolescents say they are too tired to exercise, due to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 28%的年轻人表示，由于睡眠不足而没劲儿运动。

sentences.english: Spontanous subarachnoid hemorrhage ( SAH) mostly arises from rupture and bleeding of intracranial aneurysms.
sentences.chinese: 自发性蛛网膜下腔出血多是由于颅内动脉瘤破裂引起。

sentences.english: For these reasons, Provo tied for second-to-last inisland rankings published in the November/December 2007 issue of themagazine.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些原因，普罗伏在此榜单上位列倒数第二。

sentences.english: Since it is very cold at the top, coverall is required.
sentences.chinese: 由于山顶很冷，连身服装是必须的。

sentences.english: The animals were ruthlessly hunted to the verge of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 这些动物由于遭到无情的捕猎而濒于灭绝。

sentences.english: Fourth, the failure is beyond the unit's will.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为未达既遂是由于单位意志以外的原因。

sentences.english: What helped the honeyeater elude discovery was it's silent nature.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种食蜜雀的沉默的特性使得它一直没被发现。

sentences.english: At last, it obducted and thrusted to outcrop on the surface.
sentences.chinese: 后期又由于仰冲推覆，最终出露地表。

sentences.english: With more forests being destoryed, huge quantities of good earth are washed away each year.
sentences.chinese: 由于更多森林被破坏，每年有大量的好土壤流失掉了。

sentences.english: As the lack of understanding of the disease, it's often misdiagnosed or missed diagnosis.
sentences.chinese: 由于对该疾病认识的不足，经常被误诊或者漏诊。

sentences.english: However, due to excessive blood loss, he finally can not support.
sentences.chinese: 但是由于失血过多，他终于支撑不下去了。

sentences.english: As it was dark, he stubbed his toe against the table leg.
sentences.chinese: 由于天暗看不见，他的脚趾碰到了桌子脚。

sentences.english: L2. Due to the destination is an inland city, we have to arrange sea-land intermodal transportation.
sentences.chinese: 由于目的地是内陆城市，我们只好安排海陆联运。

sentences.english: It is well-known that lung cancer is caused at least in part by smoking too much.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，肺癌至少部分是由于吸烟过多引起的。

sentences.english: Since hiring more staff for these occasions was costly, the centres needed parents to attend.
sentences.chinese: 由于再雇佣员工将很费钱，这些中心需要家长的参与。

definition: to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
therefore/as a result/thus/and as a result, ...
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
